title: FF running, dark reader
content: I have 2 questions. 1) I don't understand why Firefox often "closes badly". During a restart, I often get the error message "we must close the old Firefox". It happened even after a complete restart of the computer. How do you close it completely the first time? 2) I have used Dark Reader which has a good reputation and is useful. However, it slowed Firefox down considerably until it crashed. I deleted it, but some of the pages it had blacked out ... remain so when I reload them. How to solve this problem.
creator: rbrasseur

title: Firefox'ta youtube
content: Son iki veya üç güncelleme sonucunda youtube Studio'da video düzenleyiciye girildiğinde ekranda düzenlecek videoya basıldığında videoyu oynatmıyor. ayrıca telif hakkı dolayısı ile düzenleyiciden şarkı değiştir moduna girildiğinde youtube müzik arşivindeki müzikler "bu ses parçası oynatılamıyor" uyarısı veriyor. Aynı bölümleri Chrome ile girip denedim ve hepsi çalışıyor. Bu konuda yardımınızı rica ediyorum.
creator: rehaersavci

title: Youtube in Firefoxwbsites
content:
When I am on a website and that website has an internal video that plays on Youtube, firefox no longer plays the Youtube video and instead shows an random Playback ID error.

However, if I go directly to the Youtube website I can play videos fine with no issue.
creator: philipdeans99

title: Firefox crashs on WSL 2 saying "Channel Error: cannot send/recv" even after usual treamtent
content:
Hello, 

    I've got stacked when using Firefox on my WSL 2 instance. I introduced firefox on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS on WSL 2 as usual, and starting from the command line produced the following error messages:
      1. !!! [Parent][RunMessage] Error: Channel error: cannot send/recv 
  The browser starts with a window from WSL 2 command line, but all tabs repeat crashes and cannot use any more.   My full error messages are attached as a text file in this post. 
  Ordinarily, this glitch can be solved by using a hack that shows "about:config" and proceed with changing settings of two values of entry "browser.tabs.remote.autostart" and "browser.tabs.remote.autostart" to false.  Actually my other firefox instace on WSL could solve this problem, but this time, I cannot solve this. Firefox keeps crashing after altering these two settings. 
  I tried to make some other workarounds, such as manipulating  SELinux parater mozilla_plugin_can_network_connect to "-1", but I found SELinux was disabled in my WSL 2 at all.  
 I guess something on IPC function is missing or broken, due to for example lack of appropriate packages, but I cannot specify the solution. 
 Here is my enviroment in trouble:
  • Firefox version: 85.0 (latest on Ubuntu)
  • OS version: 20.04 LTS (with all latest patches applied)
  • System: WSL 2 (on Windows 10 Pro 20H2 64 bit)
  • X Application: VcXsrv 1.20.9.0 (maybe the latest) 
  Other GUI applications run flawlessly as far as I confirm. 
  Any comments and suggestions appreciated.
creator: terakinizers

title: Shopify Admin pages don't refresh
content:
FreeBSD 12.2 Firefox 85.0 (64-bit) - no extensions (removed uBlock Origin, Privacy Badger, HTTPS ONLY)

>> Enhanced Tracking Protection: OFF for shopify URIs >> Privacy & Security set to Standard >>>Manage Exceptions contains shopify URIs >> Block Pop-Ups contains shopify URI as exception >> HTTPS-ONLY Mode enabled

PROBLEM: see Subject At first I thought that Firefox's protection from these super-cookies they're so proud of actually hampered my browsing. However, after toggling through HTTPS-ONLY modes is appears that having this 'feature' disabled is what allows me to browse normally without a false negative of "This page is not available at this moment".

I wanted to put this out there in case anyone else has a Shopify store, uses v85 of Firefox and has similar difficulties.

Curious to hear whether the Firefox devs have any feedback ... thing is, with uBlock I have control over which domains, sub-domains and cross-domains I want to allow in terms of javascript et al while Privacy Badger used to control cookies. With Firefox's built-in protection it's more static ... still have a feeling that's where the problem is but will need to spend a little more time to draw any conclusions on my end. Maybe the built-in dev tools will shed some additional light?

Incidentally, the Chrome browser has no problem.
creator: firefox1233

title: unable to log into ebay using firefox
content:
When I went to log into ebay tonight, using mozilla firefox, I am unable to log into either one of my accounts. I get the message: Confirm your account

It looks like you signed in from a different computer. Before you continue, we need to verify your identity and confirm it's really you. Choose how you'd like to receive your confirmation code

We'll send a message to the option you select. 

   By Phone (voice or text)    By Email

Cancel


I have tried the option to receive a pin code both by text and phone call numerous times but it keeps coming back to this saying I need to confirm my account. I am using mozilla firefox on a windows 10 computer. I did try windows edge browser and was able to get in to both of my accounts on my windows 10 computer. However, I use and prefer firefox. Also, I have a windows 7 computer and I was able to log into both of my accounts using firefox. I was able to log into my ebay accounts before I updated firefox last night. I'm not sure if the new firefox update has anything to do with the problem on my windows 10 computer. I also updated firefox on my windows 7 computer and I can still log into my ebay accounts using firefox.
creator: Dakota66

title: Can I sort Bookmarks Menu with newest on top?
content: I want to start using the Bookmarks Menu. However, when I open it and mouse over the folder I want to look in, the list of bookmarks that appears has the oldest bookmarks on the top. I want the newest bookmarks on top. How can I do that?
creator: astrickland

title: session files stop updating, open session is not fresh!
content: There is a problem that has haunted me for many years, regardless of the versions of firefox, the bottom line is that when I close the browser after a long work, and open it later, an outdated session is restored, 4-5 hours old, and not the last one. Having watched the "sessionstore-backups" folder and its three files, I found that at some point these files simply stop changing, so the next time the browser is opened, the session is not fresh. Why is this happening, I cannot understand why the session files freeze and do not update despite the fact that I continue to work in firefox ??
creator: vad-athlon

title: Audio Crackle
content: The audio crackles when I stream videos. After one hour of Windows tech support trying to find the problem the tech opened Edge and played a video. No crackling. I've reset/refreshed Firefox and no good. Windows tech even tried to fix the problem. He couldn't fix it. It only happens in full screen. How do I fix this?
creator: lwwhitt7

title: Some websites do not recognize my device and require two step authentication, everytime saying now my device is registered and I won't need to do that again. What do I need to change so that their marker remains without losing all my privacy?
content: Netflix, Charles Schwab, others appear to not recognize my device and require two step authentication, every time, but saying now my device is registered and I won't need to do that again. But I do. What do I need to change so that their marker remains without losing all my privacy? Is it a cookie? Do I have to change the Dashboard to no security? Can I do that for just one website at a time?

title: This video is either unavailable or not supported in this browser. (Error #4000) / The media could not be played.
content:
I can't watch any Twitch streams and videos on Twitter give me an error. This does not happen to me while using other browsers, only Firefox.

Here is what I have tried:

I refreshed the page.

My drivers are up to date.

I do not have any media players opened.

I deleted cache and cookies.

Any help would be appreciated, thanks!

title: copy/paste
content: I'm not normally a Firefox user, but need to use it for a particular resource. I'm used to having at least 2 windows open, one for reading documents/emails and another for pasting articles, etc. into an email. I found the Firefox icons for copying & pasting, but when I copy material from one window -- in this case, a PDF document--, I'm unable to paste it into an email in another window. What do I do?
